body.p:
To his Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir
At the August Term ^1862^ of the Circuit Court of Campbell County Conrad Vieman was fined $50.00 and costs for selling liquor to a minor.

But we have no doubt that it was either a malicious prosecution or instituted merely for (the sake of a small sum to be paid by an officer or officers -- who were using the prosecuting witness to entrap the innocent) for them his own mercenary gain -- and without regard to the public good moreover, most every stranger would consider him of age --

We have known Mr. Veiman for several years past as a law abiding citizen -- and indeed the enforcement of this fine would be a very serious matter with him -- as he is on the verge of the grave with a Scrofulous disease -- and his family is almost destitute of the necessaries of life --
We therefore hope that you will conclude that it is just and proper to remit this fine --

H. Sine, City Clerk
Robt B MCracken Mayor of Newport
J, Hawthorn
Jno,, C, Mead
W G Morris
Jno, C Thomas
Henry Wendt
C. Greve
Pettn to remit fine agst Conrad Vieman by telegram of Newport
I see no reliable grounds for Executive interposition 15 Jan 63
